label: 花喰鳥
対訳語: The motif of a bird carrying a branch with blossoms in its beak
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 52nd  . Nara National Museum . 2000
説明文: A motif of a bird carrying a branch of flowers in its beak, variations on which first appeared in Sassanian and Byzantine art. This motif traveled across Central Asia, through China, and into Japan via the Silk Road and is visible on numerous treasures in the Shōsō-in. See also Ganjuchō.　[正倉院、含綬鳥]
